desc_merge: In satellite deployment missions, engineers must select scientific instruments for launch where each instrument has a weight [1, 4, 2, 10, 6, 10, 9, 3, 1, 5], a volume [5, 5, 1, 1, 5, 5, 4, 4, 3, 4], and a scientific value [7, 17, 8, 14, 20, 17, 13, 11, 12, 19]. The launch vehicle has maximum payload weight 30 and maximum fairing volume 22 constraints. The objective is to maximize total scientific return by choosing instruments that fit within both limits, which directly impacts mission success and data collection capabilities.

A cloud service provider needs to allocate virtual machines to physical servers where each VM has a CPU requirement [4, 6, 7, 10, 8, 10, 2, 5, 6, 9], a memory requirement [1, 5, 1, 2, 5, 5, 2, 3, 1, 5], and a revenue contribution [20, 15, 15, 16, 14, 11, 18, 17, 9, 13]. Each physical server has maximum CPU capacity 40 and maximum memory capacity 18. The goal is to maximize total revenue by optimally packing VMs without exceeding server capacities, ensuring efficient resource utilization and energy savings.

A financial analyst must choose stocks for a client's portfolio where each stock has a risk score [1, 8, 1, 4, 5, 3, 9, 5, 5, 9], a liquidity measure [1, 4, 3, 5, 4, 1, 5, 5, 1, 3], and an expected return [11, 18, 10, 15, 19, 17, 13, 13, 20, 8]. The portfolio has maximum acceptable risk 30 and maximum illiquidity tolerance 19. The aim is to maximize total expected return while respecting both risk and liquidity constraints, which is vital for achieving balanced investment outcomes.

A distribution center must select items for a customer shipment where each product has a weight [2, 1, 8, 10, 7, 3, 3, 1, 3, 6], a storage volume [4, 5, 4, 4, 4, 1, 1, 1, 4, 2], and a priority score [10, 7, 19, 7, 15, 18, 16, 19, 9, 10]. The shipping box has maximum weight 26 and maximum volume 18 restrictions. The objective is to maximize total priority of shipped items while adhering to packaging limits, enhancing customer satisfaction and logistics efficiency.

Defense strategists must choose equipment for a tactical vehicle where each gear piece has a weight [3, 6, 6, 9, 10, 9, 1, 4, 8, 6], a space requirement [4, 3, 3, 4, 2, 2, 1, 1, 5, 4], and a combat effectiveness rating [18, 10, 13, 15, 2, 11, 11, 2, 12, 7]. The vehicle has maximum carrying weight 37 and maximum storage volume 17. The goal is to maximize total combat effectiveness while staying within transport capabilities, which directly influences mission readiness and operational success.

Household movers need to select which furniture and boxes to load onto a truck for a residential move, where each item has a weight [9, 5, 1, 4, 7, 4, 1, 3, 7, 10], a physical size [2, 3, 1, 3, 3, 2, 1, 4, 5, 1], and a priority value [19, 7, 12, 8, 11, 5, 8, 17, 5, 17] based on necessity. The moving truck has a maximum payload capacity 30 and a fixed cargo space 15. The objective is to maximize the total priority of the transported belongings while adhering to the truck's strict weight and spatial limits, ensuring a single, efficient trip.

University administrators must design a core curriculum by selecting courses from a list, where each course requires a student workload [1, 2, 5, 4, 3, 8, 2, 8, 1, 10], consumes a fixed number of classroom hours [5, 3, 2, 3, 4, 3, 1, 4, 2, 1], and has an educational value [10, 15, 12, 14, 16, 14, 1, 12, 16, 7]. The program has a maximum acceptable student workload 26 and a total available classroom hours 16. The goal is to maximize the aggregate educational value of the selected courses without surpassing the program's workload and scheduling constraints, shaping a balanced and high-quality education.

A player in a role-playing game must choose items to carry in a limited inventory, where each item, like a weapon or potion, has a character encumbrance [9, 9, 10, 1, 7, 7, 2, 6, 1, 8], an inventory slot size [2, 3, 3, 5, 5, 1, 1, 3, 2, 3], and a gameplay benefit score [5, 16, 15, 2, 6, 6, 8, 1, 12, 3]. The character's inventory has a maximum encumbrance limit 36 and a fixed number of slots 16. The challenge is to select items that maximize the total benefit for adventuring while staying within the character's carrying capacity and inventory space, which is vital for in-game survival.

A food bank organization receives various donated food items and must choose which ones to accept for distribution, where each item has a physical weight [4, 3, 8, 1, 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 4], a storage space requirement [13, 19, 19, 14, 10, 16, 19, 5, 16, 20], and a nutritional value [3, 5, 2, 2, 5, 3, 2, 5, 4, 5]. Their storage facility has a maximum floor load capacity 28 and a total refrigerated and shelf space 21. The aim is to maximize the total nutritional value of the stored donations without exceeding the facility's structural weight limit and available storage volume, optimizing aid to the community.

A library is digitizing its special collection but faces constraints on its server infrastructure; each document to be digitized has a file size [2, 5, 5, 6, 4, 6, 1, 1, 8, 1], requires a specific amount of processing time [1, 1, 1, 4, 1, 5, 2, 2, 2, 2], and has a historical significance score [5, 15, 1, 7, 16, 6, 8, 8, 12, 18]. The library's server has a maximum storage capacity 23 and a total allocated processing time budget 12 for the project. The objective is to select a subset of documents that maximizes the total historical significance archived while complying with the digital storage and processing time limits, preserving the most valuable artifacts.

In commercial aviation, cargo managers must decide which freight items to load onto an aircraft's cargo hold where each item has a specific weight [2, 10, 8, 7, 3, 10, 7, 2, 1, 3], a storage volume [2, 4, 5, 3, 1, 3, 5, 5, 3, 4], and a revenue value [7, 17, 16, 16, 14, 19, 15, 19, 3, 2]; the aircraft has strict maximum takeoff weight 31 and available cargo space 21 constraints, and the objective is to maximize total revenue from transported freight without breaching either the weight or volume limits, a vital process for airline profitability.

For a software deployment, a DevOps engineer needs to choose which virtual machine instances to run on a physical server, where each instance type consumes a certain amount of CPU share [10, 8, 5, 6, 4, 6, 9, 8, 10, 3], memory [1, 4, 3, 4, 2, 4, 5, 5, 3, 4], and provides a performance benefit [14, 12, 10, 3, 9, 11, 3, 17, 17, 5]; the host server has a total CPU capacity 41 and a total RAM capacity 21, and the goal is to maximize the aggregate performance of the hosted instances while ensuring the server's computational and memory resources are not exceeded, optimizing infrastructure utilization.

A manufacturing plant manager must select a set of product batches to schedule in a single production cycle, with each batch requiring a machine runtime [5, 10, 9, 3, 5, 5, 9, 9, 8, 5], a floor space [5, 3, 3, 4, 5, 3, 3, 4, 2, 3], and generating a profit [1, 5, 11, 3, 4, 15, 19, 10, 7, 11]; the factory has a maximum available machine hours 40 and a limited cleanroom area 21 per cycle, and the aim is to maximize the total profit from the produced batches without surpassing the time or space constraints, which directly impacts operational throughput.

Event organizers for a music festival need to book artists for a single stage, where each performer has a set duration [2, 2, 9, 8, 9, 9, 9, 5, 10, 5], a stage setup footprint [3, 5, 1, 3, 4, 2, 2, 3, 1, 2], and an expected draw (popularity) [2, 6, 1, 20, 19, 7, 7, 16, 5, 6]; the stage has a total available time slot 40 and a maximum physical space 15 for equipment, and the objective is to maximize the overall audience attraction by selecting the optimal lineup that fits within the strict temporal and spatial limits of the venue.

Clinical researchers are selecting candidate drugs for a combined trial phase, where each drug candidate requires a dosage quantity [1, 6, 9, 2, 4, 2, 8, 7, 5, 1], a storage requirement for stability [2, 4, 2, 1, 4, 5, 4, 5, 4, 4], and has an estimated therapeutic potential [1, 17, 9, 2, 18, 10, 7, 2, 1, 6]; the trial protocol has a maximum total dosage limit for patient safety 27 and a fixed refrigeration capacity 21, and the goal is to maximize the collective therapeutic potential of the tested drugs while adhering to the safety and logistical constraints of the clinical study.

A building contractor needs to select materials from a supplier's catalog to purchase within a single truckload, where each material type has a weight [7, 1, 9, 7, 3, 3, 1, 10, 4, 4], a storage volume [3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 4, 1, 5, 2, 1], and a project criticality value [9, 4, 4, 17, 2, 10, 13, 3, 2, 16]. The delivery truck has a maximum payload 29 and a cargo space limit 18. The objective is to maximize the total criticality of materials acquired for the ongoing construction phase without surpassing the vehicle's physical constraints, directly impacting project timelines and minimizing additional delivery trips.

An art gallery must securely transport a selection of high-value artworks to a special exhibition, where each piece has a fragile weight [8, 9, 2, 5, 5, 6, 2, 9, 1, 1], a crate size [1, 4, 5, 3, 5, 5, 3, 3, 5, 5], and an insured value [14, 3, 20, 2, 17, 13, 9, 9, 18, 15]. The specialized art transport vehicle has a strict maximum load 28 and a fixed internal space 23. The goal is to maximize the total insured value of the transported collection while adhering to the vehicle's strict weight and volume restrictions, ensuring the safety and security of the priceless items.

A chip fabrication plant must choose a set of silicon wafers from a production batch to process in a single furnace cycle, where each wafer lot has a handling weight [4, 4, 2, 9, 4, 1, 5, 10, 3, 9], a required storage footprint [1, 4, 2, 5, 4, 4, 3, 4, 2, 1], and a potential revenue [9, 20, 3, 1, 20, 5, 13, 4, 17, 7]. The processing furnace has a maximum weight tolerance 30 and a fixed chamber capacity 18. The aim is to maximize the total potential revenue from the processed wafers without exceeding the furnace's operational limits, which is vital for production throughput and yield.

A team of biologists planning a remote field study must decide which scientific instruments to bring, where each instrument has a pack weight [10, 3, 5, 2, 3, 7, 1, 3, 2, 5], a bulkiness [3, 1, 1, 2, 2, 4, 5, 2, 5, 5], and a research data value [18, 2, 15, 8, 3, 13, 1, 9, 7, 7]. Their all-terrain vehicle has a maximum gross vehicle weight 24 and a limited storage area 18. The objective is to maximize the collective data-gathering potential of the equipment selected while ensuring the vehicle remains within its safe operating weight and space capacities, which is essential for the expedition's success in isolated locations.

A catering company designs a menu for a large event where each dish option has a preparation time [4, 7, 2, 8, 2, 6, 1, 7, 3, 6], a storage space requirement [2, 4, 4, 2, 3, 2, 5, 4, 4, 4], and a guest satisfaction score [13, 6, 8, 2, 13, 5, 6, 1, 5, 17]. The kitchen has maximum preparation time 27 and maximum refrigeration space 20 constraints. The objective is to select dishes that maximize total guest satisfaction while adhering to time and space limitations, ensuring efficient kitchen operations and high attendee enjoyment.

A video production studio manages its archival system where each media file has a processing load [7, 1, 10, 7, 8, 4, 10, 2, 3, 1], a storage size [8, 3, 2, 3, 18, 19, 14, 1, 3, 17], and a historical importance [4, 3, 1, 3, 5, 2, 4, 4, 1, 4]. The server has maximum processing capacity 31 and maximum storage space 18 restrictions. The aim is to retain files that maximize total historical value without exceeding system constraints, preserving critical assets while maintaining performance.

A trade show exhibitor selects display items where each exhibit has a setup time [4, 6, 8, 5, 10, 9, 7, 10, 5, 6], a footprint area [4, 5, 3, 1, 1, 1, 3, 5, 1, 3], and an engagement value [4, 4, 20, 9, 19, 6, 8, 4, 2, 3]. The booth has maximum setup duration 42 and maximum floor space 16 limits. The goal is to choose items that maximize visitor engagement while staying within time and spatial boundaries, optimizing impact within logistical confines.

A marketing firm chooses advertising slots where each slot has a cost [6, 9, 4, 9, 1, 6, 2, 8, 2, 6], an audience reach [1, 4, 1, 4, 5, 3, 3, 4, 1, 1], and an expected conversion rate [9, 13, 14, 12, 10, 13, 4, 7, 5, 17]. The campaign has a total budget 31 and a minimum reach requirement 16. The objective is to maximize total conversions while respecting budget and reach thresholds, enhancing campaign effectiveness through strategic media buying.

A funding agency evaluates research proposals where each project has a resource requirement [1, 5, 2, 6, 2, 6, 2, 2, 7, 2], a duration [1, 4, 3, 3, 3, 5, 4, 2, 3, 1], and a scientific impact score [7, 10, 1, 18, 6, 12, 5, 5, 15, 15]. The program has a total resource allocation 21 and a maximum timeline 17. The aim is to fund projects that maximize collective scientific impact without surpassing resource or temporal constraints, advancing knowledge efficiently within fixed parameters.

In freight logistics, a consolidation center must select a set of palletized shipments to load into a standard shipping container for an international voyage, where each pallet has a specific weight [10, 7, 6, 7, 2, 9, 6, 3, 5, 5], a volume [1, 2, 5, 1, 2, 5, 1, 3, 5, 2], and a revenue value [12, 13, 17, 6, 10, 18, 15, 8, 2, 6]. The container has strict maximum gross weight 36 and internal volume 16 restrictions. The objective is to maximize the total revenue from the shipped pallets without breaching the container's physical limits, a process vital for optimizing carrier profitability and vessel space utilization.

When provisioning an offshore oil platform, supply planners must choose which spare parts and consumables to send on a limited helicopter flight, with each item having a weight [6, 3, 9, 3, 8, 3, 3, 9, 9, 5], a volume [5, 5, 5, 2, 2, 3, 2, 4, 4, 1], and a criticality value [20, 12, 17, 15, 1, 8, 7, 5, 19, 5] for platform operations. The helicopter's payload has a maximum weight 34 and a maximum storage volume 19. The goal is to maximize the total criticality of the delivered supplies, ensuring uninterrupted platform functionality while adhering to the aircraft's stringent safety and capacity constraints.

A mobile medical unit preparing for a remote outreach mission needs to select medical supplies and equipment, each with a weight [1, 3, 4, 3, 10, 6, 1, 4, 2, 2], a volume [3, 5, 5, 3, 2, 3, 4, 5, 4, 3], and an expected patient benefit score [1, 16, 15, 1, 6, 17, 2, 19, 18, 20]. The vehicle used for transport has a maximum payload capacity 21 and a limited storage area with volume 22. The aim is to maximize the total expected benefit for the community served by carefully choosing items that stay within the vehicle's weight and space limitations, which directly impacts the clinic's effectiveness.

A film production manager must decide which pieces of rental equipment to procure for a location shoot, where each item, like lighting or sound gear, has a weight [4, 3, 3, 4, 10, 10, 4, 5, 8, 6], a volume [5, 5, 3, 4, 4, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4], and a creative necessity value [4, 11, 9, 17, 10, 14, 17, 14, 13, 13]. The production truck has a maximum load capacity 34 and a finite cargo space of volume 21. The objective is to maximize the total creative value of the equipment selected for the shoot without exceeding the transportation vehicle's weight and volume capacities, which is essential for staying on schedule and budget.

An agricultural research station with limited greenhouse space must choose which seed varieties to include in a biodiversity preservation study, where each seed packet has a weight [10, 6, 4, 6, 1, 7, 7, 10, 6, 8], a storage volume [1, 2, 4, 1, 4, 1, 2, 2, 1, 4], and a genetic uniqueness value [19, 3, 9, 2, 19, 3, 2, 13, 11, 10]. The allocated storage facility has a maximum weight limit 39 for the shelving and a total volume 13. The goal is to maximize the total genetic diversity preserved by selecting a subset of seeds that complies with both the weight and volume constraints of the storage unit, thereby maximizing the conservation effort's scientific impact.

In corporate data management, IT administrators must select critical digital assets for backup storage on a secure server where each asset has a storage size [3, 4, 8, 9, 9, 4, 6, 10, 6, 4], processing load [1, 5, 3, 2, 2, 1, 3, 5, 5, 3], and business criticality score [8, 8, 5, 9, 18, 18, 6, 9, 1, 4]. The server has maximum storage capacity 37 and maximum processing threshold 18. The objective is to maximize total criticality while respecting both technical constraints, ensuring business continuity and regulatory compliance.

Engineers designing a solar farm must choose photovoltaic components for installation where each unit has physical mass [10, 6, 10, 2, 2, 3, 9, 9, 8, 5], surface area requirement [3, 2, 1, 3, 1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 2], and energy output value [15, 15, 14, 2, 19, 11, 11, 5, 9, 13]. The installation platform supports maximum weight 38 and maximum area 13. The goal is to maximize total energy generation while maintaining structural integrity and space efficiency.

Disaster preparedness specialists assemble survival kits where each item has weight [4, 6, 8, 5, 5, 5, 5, 3, 8, 1], bulkiness [4, 2, 1, 1, 5, 4, 4, 3, 1, 3], and survival importance [11, 2, 19, 10, 17, 19, 7, 2, 12, 10]. The evacuation container has maximum carryable weight 30 and maximum storage space 16. The aim is to maximize lifesaving capability while ensuring portability during emergency evacuations.

Cultural institution curators select artifacts for traveling exhibitions where each piece has handling weight [6, 3, 10, 9, 2, 9, 9, 5, 5, 8], display case volume [2, 3, 4, 1, 4, 3, 4, 1, 1, 5], and cultural significance [12, 8, 3, 8, 7, 18, 9, 9, 17, 10]. The transport system has maximum weight tolerance 39 and maximum spatial dimensions 16. The challenge is to maximize exhibition impact while adhering to conservation and logistics limitations.

Farmers organizing crop transportation must select produce batches where each batch has weight [5, 7, 9, 3, 6, 6, 2, 5, 5, 3], storage volume [1, 4, 2, 5, 1, 5, 5, 1, 2, 3], and market value [2, 14, 2, 8, 12, 11, 2, 12, 13, 7]. The transport vehicle has maximum load weight 30 and maximum cargo space 17. The objective is to maximize total market value while complying with vehicle capacity and preservation requirements.

In the music industry, tour managers must select audio and lighting equipment for transport between venues, where each piece of gear has a weight [4, 4, 9, 1, 3, 4, 3, 7, 5, 3], a volume [4, 1, 3, 1, 4, 3, 1, 5, 2, 2], and a criticality value [13, 2, 18, 12, 10, 9, 12, 16, 19, 10] for the performance. The cargo truck has a strict maximum weight 25 and a maximum volume 15 it can carry. The objective is to maximize the total criticality of the equipment loaded, ensuring the show's quality, while adhering to the truck's physical constraints to avoid logistical delays.

A hospital pharmacy must choose which medications to include in a weekly restocking delivery, where each drug has a weight [7, 4, 9, 9, 8, 7, 7, 10, 5, 3], a storage volume [4, 1, 4, 2, 3, 1, 4, 3, 4, 5], and a priority value [5, 17, 5, 15, 4, 3, 14, 4, 3, 9] based on patient demand and critical need. The delivery cooler has a maximum weight 41 and a maximum internal volume 18. The goal is to maximize the total priority of the selected drugs to best serve patient care, without exceeding the cooler's capacity limits.

Marine biologists on a research cruise must decide which sampling equipment to deploy, where each instrument has a weight [9, 3, 10, 5, 10, 1, 2, 3, 8, 5], a stowage volume [3, 1, 2, 1, 4, 4, 5, 3, 1, 3], and an expected scientific data value [10, 19, 19, 19, 11, 15, 3, 19, 2, 20]. The small submersible vehicle used for deployment has a maximum payload weight 33 and a maximum storage volume 16. The aim is to maximize the total scientific value of the data collected by selecting an optimal set of instruments that fits within the submersible's strict confines.

A store manager must select products to place on a premium display shelf, where each product has a weight [2, 8, 5, 6, 5, 8, 10, 5, 7, 1] (for shelf load), a physical size [1, 4, 2, 3, 5, 5, 5, 5, 3, 5], and a marginal profit value [15, 20, 18, 12, 1, 13, 15, 19, 9, 17]. The shelf has a maximum weight capacity 34 and a total available display volume 22. The objective is to maximize the total profit from the displayed items by choosing the best product mix, while ensuring the shelf's structural and spatial limits are not surpassed.

In professional sports logistics, team managers must select which equipment items to load into a team van for an away game, where each piece of gear, from medical kits to training apparatus, has a specific weight [5, 7, 1, 3, 10, 10, 9, 1, 8, 9], a bulkiness represented by volume [4, 4, 3, 1, 5, 4, 4, 1, 5, 5], and a criticality value [9, 19, 4, 17, 8, 18, 20, 11, 20, 7] for game-day success. The transport van has a strict maximum weight 37 and a maximum cargo space 21 to adhere to. The objective is to maximize the total criticality of the transported equipment while ensuring the vehicle's weight and volumetric capacities are not exceeded, a vital process for optimal team performance and logistical efficiency.

Manufacturing facilities face the challenge of stocking a centralized tool crib with a selection of tools and instruments where each tool has an associated weight [4, 5, 1, 5, 3, 10, 7, 3, 3, 1], a storage space requirement [3, 2, 1, 5, 4, 2, 2, 5, 2, 3], and a frequency-of-use value [2, 18, 13, 9, 12, 8, 4, 7, 18, 13] that indicates its importance to production lines. The tool crib itself has physical constraints of a maximum supported weight 25 and a fixed storage volume 17. The goal is to choose a subset of tools that maximizes the overall utility based on usage frequency without surpassing the crib's structural weight limit or available space, thereby minimizing production downtime.

During underwater resupply operations, a submarine must be loaded with vital provisions and spare parts, each item characterized by its mass [7, 7, 2, 4, 1, 4, 6, 7, 9, 2], its stowage volume [3, 2, 5, 3, 3, 2, 2, 4, 5, 5], and its strategic necessity value [12, 18, 19, 19, 2, 6, 15, 8, 20, 20] for the extended mission. The submarine has critical limits for total buoyancy affected by weight 29 and internal storage capacity 20. The aim is to maximize the collective strategic value of the loaded items while strictly adhering to both the weight and volume constraints, which is paramount for the vessel's operational range and crew survival.

For a mobile scientific unit deployed in remote areas, researchers need to select which analytical instruments to include, with each instrument having a mass [1, 4, 8, 9, 4, 10, 3, 4, 2, 1], a size [2, 2, 5, 3, 5, 5, 3, 1, 1, 5], and a research value [9, 10, 14, 11, 5, 13, 16, 17, 15, 19] correlating to its experimental importance. The mobile lab vehicle imposes a maximum axle weight 27 and a finite interior space 19. The optimization problem is to maximize the total research capability by selecting instruments whose combined weight and volume do not exceed the vehicle's limits, ensuring the unit's mobility and scientific effectiveness.

In tactical operations, commanders must select critical supplies to airdrop to forward units where each supply crate has a weight [2, 4, 2, 10, 4, 7, 4, 5, 7, 6], a volume [2, 2, 5, 4, 2, 1, 5, 4, 2, 4], and a tactical priority value [16, 14, 9, 18, 14, 11, 4, 14, 15, 7]. The aircraft has maximum cargo weight 30 and maximum storage volume 18 restrictions. The objective is to maximize the tactical value delivered while ensuring payload constraints are met, which directly impacts mission success and troop survivability.

Forensic investigators need to select digital evidence files for transfer to a secure server where each file has a data size [10, 4, 2, 10, 1, 7, 2, 2, 5, 2], a processing complexity [2, 4, 5, 4, 4, 1, 2, 1, 5, 4], and an evidentiary value [6, 8, 7, 20, 20, 16, 3, 14, 5, 19]. The transfer system has maximum data load 27 and maximum processing capacity 19 limits. The goal is to maximize the total evidentiary value transferred while staying within both technical constraints, ensuring critical evidence is preserved for legal proceedings.

City planners must choose recreational facilities to install in a new park where each facility has a land footprint [8, 7, 10, 1, 5, 10, 1, 8, 8, 1], a maintenance requirement [4, 3, 5, 3, 1, 1, 3, 3, 4, 5], and a community benefit score [1, 3, 8, 4, 18, 2, 16, 5, 9, 14]. The park has maximum area 35 and maximum maintenance budget 19 constraints. The aim is to maximize overall community benefit while adhering to spatial and resource limitations, which determines the park's functionality and public satisfaction.

Movie producers must select camera equipment to rent for a shoot where each item has a physical weight [9, 7, 3, 7, 1, 3, 4, 9, 5, 6], a setup complexity [5, 2, 5, 2, 1, 2, 4, 3, 1, 2], and a production value contribution [5, 2, 5, 14, 10, 7, 11, 19, 4, 11]. The production van has maximum payload 32 and maximum setup time allowance 16 restrictions. The objective is to maximize the total production value while respecting both physical and temporal constraints, directly affecting filming efficiency and artistic quality.

Field archaeologists must choose artifacts for transportation to a research lab where each artifact has a physical mass [6, 5, 3, 5, 6, 10, 10, 1, 3, 5], a fragility rating [4, 2, 2, 4, 4, 1, 1, 2, 2, 3], and a research significance value [12, 11, 3, 11, 7, 1, 9, 3, 17, 1]. The transport case has maximum safe weight 32 and maximum protection capacity 15 limits. The goal is to maximize the total research significance transported while ensuring no damage occurs during transit, which preserves invaluable historical information.

In the assembly of a new satellite, engineers must select a set of critical components from a catalog where each component has a mass [9, 5, 2, 10, 6, 8, 3, 6, 9, 10], a spatial footprint [1, 5, 2, 4, 4, 2, 1, 3, 3, 3], and a performance contribution score [9, 5, 13, 15, 1, 12, 12, 1, 1, 20]. The satellite's payload bay has strict maximum mass 40 and maximum volume 16 constraints. The objective is to maximize the total performance score of the integrated system without exceeding the launch vehicle's mass or volumetric limits, which is fundamental to the mission's success.

For deploying a rapid-response medical unit to a remote area, logisticians must choose which medical supplies to pack where each supply crate has a weight [1, 7, 8, 8, 4, 7, 9, 6, 10, 7], a storage volume [3, 1, 5, 1, 3, 3, 3, 1, 4, 4], and a priority rating based on expected medical need [10, 18, 2, 5, 7, 10, 10, 8, 5, 12]. The transport aircraft has a maximum payload 40 and a fixed cargo hold volume 16. The goal is to maximize the overall medical preparedness by selecting the most critical supplies while adhering to the aircraft's strict weight and space limitations.

An art logistics company is tasked with securing a collection for international loan where each artwork has an insured weight [6, 8, 8, 2, 9, 10, 7, 6, 4, 2], a crate size [5, 2, 4, 1, 1, 4, 3, 5, 5, 4], and an irreplaceability value [5, 3, 16, 16, 2, 1, 6, 1, 9, 9]. The specialized climate-controlled transport container has a maximum load limit 37 and a fixed internal volume 20. The aim is to maximize the total cultural value of the transported collection without compromising the structural integrity or environmental controls of the container.

When preparing an autonomous underwater vehicle (AUV) for a deep-sea survey, scientists must select scientific instruments where each instrument has a mass [10, 1, 9, 3, 7, 1, 1, 4, 3, 9], a physical size [1, 4, 2, 2, 2, 4, 1, 3, 2, 2], and a data value score [19, 17, 16, 12, 13, 2, 18, 7, 11, 3]. The AUV has a maximum buoyancy-adjusted mass capacity 28 and limited external mounting space with a total volume 13. The objective is to maximize the scientific return of the mission by choosing the optimal suite of instruments that fit within the vehicle's strict operational constraints.

A humanitarian organization is assembling emergency shelter kits for rapid deployment where each kit component (e.g., tent, sleeping bag, stove) has a weight [9, 4, 7, 8, 3, 1, 6, 4, 9, 3], a packed size [1, 5, 3, 5, 1, 2, 4, 3, 3, 2], and a utility score for survival [20, 13, 3, 10, 5, 12, 12, 5, 19, 20]. The standard shipping pallet used for airlift has a maximum weight 32 and a maximum cubic volume 17. The goal is to maximize the survival utility provided by each palletized kit while ensuring it can be transported and handled efficiently within the established logistics framework.

Shipping companies must select cargo containers to load onto a vessel where each container has a weight [9, 4, 2, 6, 9, 4, 8, 9, 4, 7], a volume [5, 4, 1, 3, 3, 1, 2, 2, 3, 5], and a revenue value [7, 3, 6, 11, 14, 4, 6, 12, 18, 11]. The ship has maximum weight 37 and maximum volume 17 constraints. The objective is to maximize total revenue by choosing containers that fit within the vessel's weight and volume capacities, which directly impacts operational profitability and resource utilization.

Medical teams assembling kits for field operations must choose supplies where each item has a weight [2, 5, 8, 9, 4, 4, 8, 5, 5, 5], a volume [3, 2, 5, 3, 2, 1, 5, 4, 1, 1], and a criticality score [6, 2, 5, 1, 3, 11, 8, 4, 4, 19]. The kit bag has maximum weight 33 and maximum volume 16 limits. The goal is to maximize the total criticality of included supplies while adhering to the bag's constraints, ensuring life-saving capabilities in resource-limited environments.

Media archivists need to select videos for storage on a server where each file has a data size [4, 4, 5, 3, 1, 1, 7, 1, 1, 6], a processing requirement [4, 1, 2, 1, 3, 2, 2, 1, 4, 4], and a cultural value [19, 7, 20, 17, 14, 15, 7, 19, 11, 10]. The server has maximum storage 19 and maximum processing load 14 capacities. The aim is to maximize the total cultural value of archived videos without exceeding server limitations, preserving important digital heritage efficiently.

Tour operators packing gear for guided expeditions must choose equipment where each piece has a weight [4, 9, 2, 6, 1, 5, 5, 9, 6, 2], a bulkiness [2, 3, 1, 5, 1, 2, 4, 5, 4, 5], and a safety utility [5, 20, 9, 11, 2, 14, 20, 7, 18, 19].
